title: 110_hr821
content: The "Everyone Deserves Unconditional Access to Education (EDUCATE) Act" may be cited as the short title. This Act includes an amendment to IDEA. Section 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is amended to authorize specific funding amounts for fiscal year 2008. For fiscal years 2009 and 2010, specific funding amounts are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, with appropriations totaling $3,209,117,000 for 2009 and $15,738,479,000 for 2010. For fiscal years 2011 and 2012, appropriations totaling $17,972,975,000 and $20,524,716,000 are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. For fiscal years 2013 and 2014, appropriations totaling $23,438,744,000 and $26,766,497,000 are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. For fiscal years 2014 and 2015, appropriations totaling $16,064,780,000 and $30,566,712,000 are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. Appropriations totaling 26.2 percent of the determined amount for each fiscal year from 2016 onwards are hereby allocated for obligations starting on July 1 of each year and remaining available until September 30 of the following fiscal year. For the 2004-2005 school year, States receiving special education services for children aged 3 through 21 will have funding calculated based on a formula involving per-pupil expenditure and population percentages. Offsets for amounts appropriated in the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act must be spent in accordance with pay-as-you-go requirements.
